Name: Battleaxe
Description: Battleaxe is a common variant of the Battleaxes family of weapons. It is a martial melee weapon that can be wielded in one hand, or with both hands for extra damage.
Action 1: Cleave: Swing your weapon in a large arc to attack up to 3 enemies at once. They each take half the damage your weapon usually deals.
Action 2: Lacerate: Slash at your target's vital points to make it Bleed. Some Undead and Constructs can't suffer Bleeding.
Action 3: Maiming Strike: Possibly Maims your target. They can't move. Flying creatures can't be Maimed.

Name: Club of Hill Giant Strength
Description: Club of Hill Giant Strength is an uncommon club that that sets the wearer's Strength to 19.
Special Attribute 1: Splinters of a Giant's Might: Increases Strength to 19.
Action 1: Concussive Smash: Hit an enemy with all your might to deal damage and possibly Daze them.
Location: Found by breaking the Stool of Hill Giant Strength on the highest floor of Arcane Tower, with Bernard. The stool is underneath the thatched roof section in the furthest corner, standing upright. X:-26Y:-272

Name: Enforcer Club
Description: Enforcer Club is an uncommon, lightly enchanted (+1) variant of the Clubs family of weapons. It is a simple melee weapon wielded in one hand. It's a light weapon that anyone can dual-wield without special training.
Special Attribute 1: Non-Lethality: This weapon deals only Non-Lethal Damage.
Action 1: Concussive Smash: Hit an enemy with all your might to deal damage and possibly Daze them.
Action 2: Weakening Strike: Target an enemy's hands with a non-lethal attack and possibly inflict Weak Grip. Creatures without weapons can't have Weak Grip.
Action 3: Backbreaker: Put extra force behind your strike to possibly knock your enemy Prone.
Location: Not accessible through normal gameplay, but can still be accessed via third party tools.

Name: Ironwood Club
Description: Ironwood Club is an uncommon +1 Club that deals extra Bludgeoning damage when Shillelagh is cast on it.
Special Attribute 1: When Shillelagh is cast on this weapon, grants Ironwood Harmony (+1d4 Bludgeoning damage).
Action 1: Concussive Smash: Hit an enemy with all your might to deal damage and possibly Daze them.
Action 2: Backbreaker: Put extra force behind your strike to possibly knock your enemy Prone.
Location: Ironwood Harmony  Deals an additional 1d4Bludgeoning while imbued with the druidic magic of Shillelagh.

Name: Shadow Lantern
Description: Shadow Lantern is a unique type of Moonlantern which does not produce light and grants the unique Conjure Shadow Lantern Wraith spell.
Special Attribute 1: Conjure Shadow Lantern Wraith: Cast as a level 6 spell (Recharge: Long rest).
Location: Obtainable from Balthazar's hidden room in Moonrise Towers when Gale is in the party:  To access Balthazar's hidden room, interact with the top right Protruding Book ('Musty Tomes') and insert one of the human hearts from the room into the small Ancient Altar. Within the hidden room, interact with the ritual circle with Gale and combine a Dead Pixie with a Broken Moonlantern. Any other character can try to craft the lantern, but must first overcome Gale's protests and a DC 30 Arcana check.

Name: Torch
Description: Torch is utility item as a light source and doubles as improvised weapon of the Clubs family. It is a simple melee weapon wielded in one hand. It's a light weapon that anyone can dual-wield without special training. Can ignite flammable surfaces or clouds if it makes proper contact.
Location: Found throughout the game.

Name: Torch of Revocation
Description: Torch of Revocation is a very rare +1 utility item carried by Mystic Carrion and used in exorcisms.
Location: Dropped by Mystic Carrion, given as a potential reward for Find Mystic Carrion's Servant, or sold by him through dialogue for 3000 gold. Can also be stolen from the locked chest behind him.

Location: Currently can not be found in-game.

Voss must be disarmed before beginning the encounter, as he immediately flies away when any hostile action is taken and the party is locked into dialogue when approaching close enough. Due to his high stats, the chance of failing the disarm attempt against him is very high, so this method may require multiple reloads or extensive preparation. See: Guide: Early Silver Sword. Using Honeyed Paws while having a divination wizard with a 15 or higher portent die nearby allows you to guarantee that he drops his weapon. You can long rest until you get 15 or higher and make the bear invisible[note 1] so he can approach Voss. Sometimes Voss will only drop a Githyanki Crossbow, or the weapon he drops will simply phase out of existence. The triggers for these anomalies are not known. The sword can be acquired in Act Three before entering the Lower City during Deal with the Devil. If you don't sign the contract but lie to Voss, he will give you the sword (DC 30 Deception check).

Action 2: Piercing Strike: Stab an enemy and possibly inflict Gaping Wounds. Undead and Constructs can't suffer Gaping Wounds.
Action 3: Brace (6m / 20ft): Spend 6m / 20ft of your movement. For the rest of your turn, roll melee damage twice and use the highest result.

Name: Pike +1
Description: Pike +1 is an uncommon, lightly enchanted (+1) variant of the Pikes family of weapons. It is a martial melee weapon that's wielded with both hands.  It gives the user extra reach in melee combat.
Action 1: Rush Attack: Charge forward and attack the first enemy in your way, possibly pushing them Off Balance.
Action 2: Piercing Strike: Stab an enemy and possibly inflict Gaping Wounds. Undead and Constructs can't suffer Gaping Wounds.
Action 3: Brace (6m / 20ft): Spend 6m / 20ft of your movement. For the rest of your turn, roll melee damage twice and use the highest result.
Location: Has a chance to be sold by any trader using the magic melee table each time the player resets trader's inventories by long resting or levelling up.

Name: Returning Pike
Description: Returning Pike is an uncommon +1 Pike that returns to the wielder automatically after being thrown.
Special Attribute 1: Homing Weapon: This weapon will return to its owner when thrown.
Action 1: Rush Attack: Charge forward and attack the first enemy in your way, possibly pushing them Off Balance.
Action 2: Piercing Strike: Stab an enemy and possibly inflict Gaping Wounds. Undead and Constructs can't suffer Gaping Wounds.
Action 3: Brace (6m / 20ft): Spend 6m / 20ft of your movement. For the rest of your turn, roll melee damage twice and use the highest result.
Location: This weapon can be bought from Grat the Trader in the Goblin Camp

Name: The Impaler
Description: The Impaler is a very rare, inaccessible, moderately enchanted (+2) Pike that deals additional damage to targets at full hp and grants temporary hp on kills.
Special Attribute 1: Break the Unbroken: Deals an additional 1d10Piercing to targets that still have all their hit points.
Special Attribute 2: Death Drinker: Has no effect when used ingame
Action 1: Rush Attack: Charge forward and attack the first enemy in your way, possibly pushing them Off Balance.
Action 2: Piercing Strike: Stab an enemy and possibly inflict Gaping Wounds. Undead and Constructs can't suffer Gaping Wounds.
Action 3: Brace (6m / 20ft): Spend 6m / 20ft of your movement. For the rest of your turn, roll melee damage twice and use the highest result.
Special Action 1: Bloodrender: Deal additional damage equal to your proficiency bonus. On a successful hit, you gain Bloodrender which lets you deal more damage at the cost of some hitpoints.

Name: Unseen Menace
Description: Unseen Menace is a rare +1 Pike increases critical hit chance and grants Advantage as long as the wielder keeps connecting hits.
Special Attribute 1: Invisible Weapon: This weapon is Invisible while equipped. It has Advantage on Attack rolls. It loses this property for 2 rounds on a missed Attack roll. The weapon also scores a critical hit when rolling a 19.
Action 1: Rush Attack: Charge forward and attack the first enemy in your way, possibly pushing them Off Balance.
Action 2: Piercing Strike: Stab an enemy and possibly inflict Gaping Wounds. Undead and Constructs can't suffer Gaping Wounds.
Action 3: Brace (6m / 20ft): Spend 6m / 20ft of your movement. For the rest of your turn, roll melee damage twice and use the highest result.
Location: Act 1: Sold by A'jak'nir Jeera at Crèche Y'llek

Name: Bigboy's Chew Toy
Description: Bigboy's Chew Toy is a rare +1 quarterstaff that grants its wielder the ability the ability to cast Enlarge on themselves once per Long Rest.
Special Attribute 1: Whossa Large Fellow?: Cast as a level 2 spell (Recharge: Long rest).
Action 1: Concussive Smash: Hit an enemy with all your might to deal damage and possibly Daze them.
Action 2: Flourish: Feint an attack to possibly throw your opponent Off Balance.
Action 3: Topple: Swipe at a creature to knock it Prone.
Location: Sold by Lann Tarv in the main floor of Moonrise Towers.

Name: Cacophony
Description: Cacophony is a rare +1 Quarterstaff that grants the wielder the Thunderous Smite spell.
Special Attribute 1: Thunderous Smite: Cast as a level 1 spell (Recharge: Short rest).
Action 1: Topple: Swipe at a creature to knock it Prone.
Location: This weapon can be bought from these traders: Sold by Lady Esther at the Rosymorn Monastery Trail, after taking the Mountain Path and starting Act Two.

Name: Caitiff Staff
Description: Caitiff Staff is a rare, moderately enchanted (+2) special variant of the Quarterstaves family of weapons. It is a simple melee weapon that can be wielded in one hand, or with both hands for extra damage.
Special Attribute 1: Arcane Enchantment: You gain a +1 bonus to Spell Save DC and Spell attack rolls.
Special Attribute 2: Caitiff's Restoration: Replenish 1 expended Warlock spell slots (Recharge: Long rest).
Action 1: Topple: Swipe at a creature to knock it Prone.
Location: Purchased from Helsik in the Devil's Fee

Name: Corellon's Grace
Description: Corellon's Grace is an uncommon Quarterstaff that increases the wielder's Armour Class if the wielder is not wearing any armour. They also gain a bonus to Attack Rolls and Damage Rolls if attacking while unarmed.
Special Attribute 1: Natural Pugilist: You gain a +1 bonus to Unarmed Attack rolls and damage.
Special Attribute 2: Unhampered Resistance: While the wielder is not wearing armour, they receive a +2 bonus to Saving throw.
Action 1: Topple: Swipe at a creature to knock it Prone.
Location: This weapon can be bought or looted from Auntie Ethel in the Riverside Teahouse or the Hollow in the Druid Grove.

Name: Creation's Echo
Description: Creation's Echo is a rare Quarterstaff that grants the wielder resistance to Acid, Fire, Lightning, Radiant, or Necrotic damage after first dealing damage of that element.
Special Attribute 1: Elemental Resonance: If the wielder deals Acid, Fire, Lightning, Radiant, or Necrotic damage, it become resistant to that damage type for 2 turns.
Action 1: Topple: Swipe at a creature to knock it Prone.
Location: Sold by Omeluum in the Myconid Colony after completing his quest Help Omeluum investigate the parasite.

Name: Despair of Athkatla
Description: Despair of Athkatla is a rare +2 Quarterstaff that enhances the wielder's spells.
Special Attribute 1: Arcane Enchantment: You gain a +1 bonus to Spell Save DC and Spell attack rolls.
Action 1: Topple: Swipe at a creature to knock it Prone.
Location: Looted from Lorroakan in Ramazith's Tower during Act Three.

Name: Gold Wyrmling Staff
Description: Gold Wyrmling Staff is a rare quarterstaff that deals additional Fire damage with melee strikes and grants its wielder the Fire Bolt cantrip.
Special Attribute 1: Fire Bolt: Cast as a cantrip at will.
Action 1: Topple: Swipe at a creature to knock it Prone.
Location: Bought or stolen from Roah Moonglow in the Shattered Sanctum X:275Y:-29. On a pedestal beneath the stained glass window behind the lava and water elementals on the ground floor of Sorcerous Sundries, Lower City X:-2Y:-66.

Name: Harper Sacredstriker
Description: Harper Sacredstriker is a rare +1 Quarterstaff that grants the wielder the Spiritual Weapon spell at level 6.
Special Attribute 1: Spiritual Weapon: Cast as a level 6 spell (Recharge: Long rest).
Action 1: Topple: Swipe at a creature to knock it Prone.
Location: If Rolan is dead: Sold by Lorroakan's Projection in Sorcerous Sundries If Rolan and Lorroakan are both alive: Sold by Rolan in Sorcerous Sundries If Rolan is alive but Lorroakan is dead: Can be pickpocketed from Rolan in Ramazith's Tower

Name: Hollow's Staff
Description: Hollow's Staff is a rare +1 Quarterstaff that makes it difficult for enemies to resist the wielder's spells, and grants the wielder the Arms of Hadar spell.
Special Attribute 1: Heightened Necromancy: Creatures have Disadvantage on Saving throws against your necromancy spells.
Special Attribute 2: Arms of Hadar: Cast as a level 3 spell (Recharge: Long rest).
Action 1: Topple: Swipe at a creature to knock it Prone.
Location: Can be disarmed or looted from Lucretious at the Circus of The Last Days in Rivington

Name: Incandescent Staff
Description: Incandescent Staff is a very rare Quarterstaff that grants the wielder extra Spell Attack and resistance to Fire damage. It also grants the ability to cast the Fire Bolt and Fireball spells.
Special Attribute 1: Ranged Spell Attack +1
Special Attribute 2: Resistance to Fire damage
Special Attribute 3: Fire Bolt: Cast as a cantrip at will.
Special Attribute 4: Fireball: Cast as a level 3 spell (Recharge: Long rest).
Action 1: Topple: Swipe at a creature to knock it Prone.
Location: Sold by Quartermaster Talli in Last Light Inn during Act Two

Name: Markoheshkir
Description: Markoheshkir is a legendary +2 quarterstaff that empowers the wielder's spells and can be tuned towards a certain element, granting extra spells and effects. It can also cast a spell for free, once per long rest.
Special Attribute 1: Arcane Enchantment: You gain a +1 bonus to Spell Save DC and Spell attack rolls.
Special Attribute 2: Arcane Battery: Alleviate the arcane burden of spellcasting with the power of this staff. The next spell you cast doesn't cost a spell slot. You need to toggle this feature on in order to activate this effect.
Special Attribute 3: Kereska's Favour: Cast as a level 4 spell (Recharge: Short rest).
Action 1: Topple: Swipe at a creature to knock it Prone.
Location: Located inside a Globe of Invulnerability in Ramazith's Tower during Act Three. (Use See Invisibility to see the lever and disable the globe)

Name: Melf's First Staff
Description: The Melf's First Staff is a variant of the Quarterstaves that improve Spell Save DC and Spell Attack Rolls, and allows the wearer to cast Melf's Acid Arrow.
Special Attribute 1: Arcane Enchantment: You gain a +1 bonus to Spell Save DC and Spell attack rolls.
Special Attribute 2: Melf's Acid Arrow: Cast as a level 2 spell (Recharge: Long rest).
Action 1: Topple: Swipe at a creature to knock it Prone.
Location: Sold by Blurg in the Myconid Colony.

Name: Mourning Frost
Description: Mourning Frost is a very rare, +1 Quarterstaff that enhances the wielder's Cold damaging spells with extra damage and the Chilled condition.
Special Attribute 1: Heart of Ice: When dealing Cold damage, the wielder deals an additional 1Cold.
Special Attribute 2: Insidious Cold: Dealing Cold damage with a spell possibly inflicts Chilled upon the target.
Special Attribute 3: Ray of Frost: Cast as a cantrip at will.
Action 1: Topple: Swipe at a creature to knock it Prone.
Location: Created by combining the components carried by the three Drow mages competing to discover the Adamantine Forge. They are found at various locations within the Underdark.   Icy Helve - carried by Dhourn, west of the Selûnite Outpost. Icy Metal - looted from Xargrim the Pale Corpse within the Myconid Colony, in the secret area unlocked by completing the quest Defeat the Duergar Intruders X:50Y:75, by casting Knock, or by using a skill like Misty Step from the right angle. Icy Crystal - carried by Filro the Forgotten near the Sussur Tree.

Name: Nature's Snare
Description: Nature's Snare is a variant of the Quarterstaves family of weapons that gives its wielder a chance to Ensnare non-plants and non-beasts on hit.
Special Attribute 1: Fly Trap: Chance to Ensnare target if it is not a plant or a beast.
Action 1: Topple: Swipe at a creature to knock it Prone.
Location: Looted from a locked chest within the Underground Passage of the Druid Grove X:-425Y:-200. The key to the chest can be found on a corpse on the lower part of the island in the middle, guarded by two turret statues.

Name: Pale Oak
Description: Pale Oak is a rare Quarterstaff that grants the Faithwarden's Vines spell and prevents the wielder from being Ensnared by vines.
Special Attribute 1: Faithwarden's Stride: Druidic vines cannot Ensnare you and do not count as difficult terrain.
Special Attribute 2: Faithwarden's Vines: Cast as a level 1 spell (Recharge: Long rest).
Action 1: Topple: Swipe at a creature to knock it Prone.
Location: Obtained as a reward for completing the quest Investigate Kagha and both persuading and sparing Kagha, which must be completed before the quest Rescue the Druid Halsin. In this scenario, Kagha will give you the Pale Oak. If Kagha is killed, then all of the shadow druids and rogue Emerald Grove druids must also be defeated including Loic and Marcoryl. If Marcoryl isn't in the main chamber, he will likely be in the Servant's Quarters and will attack on sight after Khaga is defeated. In this scenario, Rath will give you the Pale Oak. This reward is available only to Druids.

Name: Quarterstaff
Description: Quarterstaff is a mundane, nonmagical variant of the Quarterstaves family of weapons. It is a simple melee weapon that can be wielded in one hand, or with both hands for extra damage.
Action 1: Topple: Swipe at a creature to knock it Prone.
Special Action 1: Topple: Swipe at a creature to knock it Prone.
Location: Starting equipment for druid (unique appearance). Starting equipment for monk, sorcerer and wizard.

Name: Quarterstaff +1
Description: Quarterstaff +1 is an uncommon, lightly enchanted (+1) variant of the Quarterstaves family of weapons. It is a simple melee weapon that can be wielded in one hand, or with both hands for extra damage.
Action 1: Topple: Swipe at a creature to knock it Prone.
Location: Has a chance to be sold by any trader using the magic melee table each time the player resets trader's inventories by long resting or levelling up.

Name: Rain Dancer
Description: Rain Dancer is an uncommon Quarterstaff that grants the wielder the ability to cast Create Water, once per Short Rest.
Special Attribute 1: Create Water: Cast as a level 1 spell (Recharge: Short rest).
Action 1: Topple: Swipe at a creature to knock it Prone.
Location: Sold by Arron in the Druid Grove

Name: Ritual Staff
Description: The Ritual Staff is a mundane, nonmagical variant of the Quarterstaves family of weapons. It is a simple melee weapon that can be wielded in one hand, or with both hands for extra damage.
Action 1: Topple: Swipe at a creature to knock it Prone.
Location: Dropped by Goblin Booyahg

Name: Spiderstep Staff
Description: Spiderstep Staff is an uncommon variant of the Quarterstaves family of weapons. It is a simple melee weapon that can be wielded in one hand, or with both hands for extra damage.
Special Attribute 1: Spider Step: Immune to being Enwebbed. Your Movement Speed is not affected by web surfaces.
Action 1: Topple: Swipe at a creature to knock it Prone.
Location: Not accessible through normal gameplay, but can still be accessed via third party tools.

Name: Staff
Description: Staff is a mundane, nonmagical variant of the Quarterstaves family of weapons. It is a simple melee weapon that can be wielded in one hand, or with both hands for extra damage.
Action 1: Topple: Swipe at a creature to knock it Prone.
Location: Lying on a table in Golbraith's Cellar, which can be accessed through a hatch in Golbraith's House X:-152Y:-55, which is right next to a manhole in the Lower City that leads to the Lower City Sewers.

Name: Staff of Accretion
Description: Staff of Accretion is a rare, lightly enchanted (+1) variant of the Quarterstaves family of weapons. It is a simple melee weapon that can be wielded in one hand, or with both hands for extra damage.
Special Attribute 1: Accretion: The wearer gains Arcane Charge when they deal damage with close-quarter-range spells or close-quarter-range cantrips.
Action 1: Topple: Swipe at a creature to knock it Prone.
Location: Not accessible through normal gameplay, but can still be accessed via third party tools.

Name: Staff of Arcane Blessing
Description: Staff of Arcane Blessing is a uncommon Quarterstaff that grants the wielder the ability to cast Bless. In addition, all Bless spells cast by the wielder grant an additional +1d4 to spell attack rolls.
Special Attribute 1: Mystra's Blessing: Creatures you Bless also gain Mystra's Blessing for an additional 1d4 bonus to spell attack rolls.
Special Attribute 2: Bless: Cast as a level 1 spell (Recharge: Long rest).
Action 1: Topple: Swipe at a creature to knock it Prone.
Location: This staff is found leaning up against a table in the basement of the Arcane Tower. To reach the basement, the player must either convince Bernard on the top floor to leave Guiding Light on a table, or defeat Bernard and take it. The ring can be used to activate a secret button on the tower's teleporter pad to reach the basement. Another way to reach the basement of the Arcane Tower is to go up the stairs behind the generator, use Feather Fall, and jump down to the gap between the wall and the wooden staircase. If the party has a character capable of casting Mage Hand, they can also cast it under the stairs through the same gap, and direct it to operate the switch which will open a hidden door in the wall.

Name: Staff of Crones
Description: Staff of Crones is an uncommon Quarterstaff and Story Item that grants the wielder the ability to cast the spell Ray of Sickness, once per Short Rest.
Special Attribute 1: Ray of Sickness: Cast as a level 1 spell (Recharge: Short rest).
Action 1: Topple: Swipe at a creature to knock it Prone.
Location: Looted from the ground in the treasure room of the Ancient Abode (the Hag's lair) beneath Auntie Ethel's Teahouse.

Name: Staff of Interruption
Description: Staff of Interruption is a rare quarterstaff that allows the wielder to cast Counterspell at Level 5.
Special Attribute 1: Counterspell: Cast as a level 5 spell (Recharge: Long rest).
Action 1: Topple: Swipe at a creature to knock it Prone.
Location: Rewarded by Mayrina after you finish the quest Help the Hag Survivors

Name: Staff of Spell Power
Description: Staff of Spell Power is a very rare + 2 Quarterstaff that empowers the wielder's spells and can cast a spell without a spell slot, once per Long Rest.
Special Attribute 1: Arcane Enchantment: You gain a +1 bonus to Spell Save DC and Spell attack rolls.
Special Attribute 2: Arcane Battery: Alleviate the arcane burden of spellcasting with the power of this staff. The next spell you cast doesn't cost a spell slot. You need to toggle this feature on in order to activate this effect.
Action 1: Topple: Swipe at a creature to knock it Prone.
Location: Found in the House of Hope in a vault across from the entrance to the Boudoir. The player will need to pass a DC10 Wisdom check to activate the Inert Infernal Gem and then a DC20 Arcana check to use the Infernal Control Gem to open the door. The staff will be located on a stone pedestal to the right X:-6486Y:2939.

Name: Staff of the Emperor
Description: Staff of the Emperor is a rare +2 Quarterstaff that enhances the wielder's spells and possibly stuns enemy spellcasters.
Special Attribute 1: Arcane Enchantment: You gain a +1 bonus to Spell Save DC and Spell attack rolls.
Special Attribute 2: Imperial Retaliation: When the wielder succeeds a Saving throw, the foe that caused the throw needs to make an Intelligence Saving throw or be Stunned for 1 turn.
Action 1: Topple: Swipe at a creature to knock it Prone.
Location: Can by acquired by disarming The Emperor.

Name: Staff of the Ram
Description: The Staff of the Ram is a +2 Quarterstaff that can Stun and push back a target on a hit.
Special Attribute 1: Staff of the Ram: Once per turn, the blow possibly knocks a foe back 2m / 6.5ft and Stuns them. This has no effect on dragons or Huge creatures.
Action 1: Topple: Swipe at a creature to knock it Prone.
Location: Found in an Opulent Chest X:-1572Y:-976 in Jaheira's Hideout Basement under Elerrathin's Home in the Lower City. The chest is in a room behind a DC18 locked bookcase X:-1562Y:980.

Name: The Spellsparkler
Description: The Spellsparkler is a rare Quarterstaff that allows the wielder to generate Lightning Charges upon dealing damage with spells.
Special Attribute 1: Electric Veins: When the wielder deals damage with a spell or cantrip, they gain 2 Lightning Charges.
Action 1: Topple: Swipe at a creature to knock it Prone.
Location: Reward for rescuing Counsellor Florrick from the burning inn of Waukeen's Rest during the quest Rescue the Grand Duke. One of three possible rewards for this quest, the other two being The Sparky Points and The Joltshooter.

Name: Woe
Description: Woe is a very rare, +2 Quarterstaff wielded by Cazador Szarr. It grants better Spell Save DC and Spell Attack Rolls, access to the Blight spell, and healing when creatures fail Saving Throws by the caster's spells.
Special Attribute 1: Arcane Enchantment: You gain a +1 bonus to Spell Save DC and Spell attack rolls.
Special Attribute 2: Arcane Vampirism: When the creatures affected by your spells fail any associated Saving throws, you regain 1d4hit points.
Special Attribute 3: Blight: Cast as a level 4 spell (Recharge: Long rest).
Action 1: Topple: Swipe at a creature to knock it Prone.
Location: Reward for defeating Cazador Szarr during The Pale Elf.

Name: Staff of Cherished Necromancy
Description: Staff of Cherished Necromancy is a very rare +2 Quarterstaff that greatly enhances Necromancy spells and can use a dead creature's essence to cast a Necromancy spell without costing a spell slot.
Special Attribute 1: Heightened Necromancy: Creatures have Disadvantage on Saving throws against your necromancy spells.
Special Attribute 2: Life Essence Harvest: When the wielder kills a hostile creature with a spell, they greedily absorb its energy and gain Life Essence until their next Long Rest.
Action 1: Topple: Swipe at a creature to knock it Prone.
Location: Can be looted from Mystic Carrion in Philgrave's Mansion inside the Lower City.

Name: Duellist's Prerogative
Description: Duellist's Prerogative is a legendary, +3 Rapier that grants the wielder a greater chance of critical hits, and an extra reaction provided their off-hand is empty. The wielder can also use a reaction to grant additional Necrotic damage on a hit.
Special Attribute 1: Elegant Duellist: While your off-hand is empty, you score a Critical Hit when rolling a 19. Moreover, you gain an additional Reaction per turn.
Special Attribute 2: Withering Cut: On a hit with a melee weapon, use a Reaction to deal additional Necrotic damage equal to your Proficiency Bonus.
Special Attribute 3: Challenge to Duel: Challenge an enemy to attack only you, inflicting Bleeding on the target. at will.
Action 1: Flourish: Feint an attack to possibly throw your opponent Off Balance.
Action 2: Piercing Strike: Stab an enemy and possibly inflict Gaping Wounds. Undead and Constructs can't suffer Gaping Wounds.
Action 3: Weakening Strike: Target an enemy's hands with a non-lethal attack and possibly inflict Weak Grip. Creatures without weapons can't have Weak Grip.
Special Action 1: Dueller's Enthusiasm: While you are not dual-wielding, you can make an additional melee attack with The Dueller.
Location: Reward for completing the quest Save Vanra.

Name: Harmonic Dueller
Description: Harmonic Dueller is a rare +1 Rapier that when activated, can grant all the wielder's melee attacks extra damage equal to their Charisma modifier.
Action 1: Flourish: Feint an attack to possibly throw your opponent Off Balance.
Action 2: Piercing Strike: Stab an enemy and possibly inflict Gaping Wounds. Undead and Constructs can't suffer Gaping Wounds.
Action 3: Weakening Strike: Target an enemy's hands with a non-lethal attack and possibly inflict Weak Grip. Creatures without weapons can't have Weak Grip.
Special Action 1: Mellow Harmony: You make a DC 15 Performance check, success granting all your melee weapon attacks additional damage equal to your Charisma Modifier (minimum 1 additional damage).
Location: Sold by Entharl Danthelon at Danthelon's Dancing Axe in Wyrm's Crossing.

Name: Pelorsun Blade
Description: Pelorsun Blade is a very rare +1 Rapier that automatically grants the wielder Advantage against Undead targets.
Special Attribute 1: Undead Bane: All Attack rolls have Advantage against Undead.[See Notes]
Action 1: Flourish: Feint an attack to possibly throw your opponent Off Balance.
Action 2: Piercing Strike: Stab an enemy and possibly inflict Gaping Wounds. Undead and Constructs can't suffer Gaping Wounds.
Action 3: Weakening Strike: Target an enemy's hands with a non-lethal attack and possibly inflict Weak Grip. Creatures without weapons can't have Weak Grip.
Location: Found in Cazador's Dungeon. From the waypoint, take the second open door on the right. There is a door on the floor below. Teleport or jump down and enter the door. The item is found in this room under a dirt mound, inside a DC15 trapped Rosewood Casket X:-1928Y:852.

Name: Infernal Rapier
Description: The Infernal Rapier is a very rare rapier and a possible reward for following Wyll's companion quest. It raises your Spell Save DC and, unlike other rapiers, uses your Spellcasting Modifier for Attack Rolls and Damage Rolls instead of Strength or Dexterity.
Special Attribute 1: High Spellcasting: You gain a +1 bonus to Spell Save DC.
Special Attribute 2: Melee Caster: Instead of its Dexterity Modifier, the affected entity add its Spellcasting Ability Modifier to Attack rolls.
Special Attribute 3: Planar Ally: Cambion: Cast as a level 6 spell (Recharge: Long rest).
Action 1: Piercing Strike: Stab an enemy and possibly inflict Gaping Wounds. Undead and Constructs can't suffer Gaping Wounds.
Action 2: Weakening Strike: Target an enemy's hands with a non-lethal attack and possibly inflict Weak Grip. Creatures without weapons can't have Weak Grip.
Action 3: Flourish: Feint an attack to possibly throw your opponent Off Balance.
Location: Potential reward during Wyll's companion quest, The Blade of Frontiers, at the end of Act Two. Bring Wyll along when enterring the Mind Flayer Colony, free Zariel's asset, then pass a DC 14 Persuasion Check to successfully ask for a reward.

Name: Rapier
Description: Rapier is a mundane, nonmagical variant of the Rapiers family of weapons. It is a martial melee weapon wielded in one hand. As a finesse weapon, it can benefit from the wielder's Dexterity and not just their Strength.
Action 1: Piercing Strike: Stab an enemy and possibly inflict Gaping Wounds. Undead and Constructs can't suffer Gaping Wounds.
Action 2: Weakening Strike: Target an enemy's hands with a non-lethal attack and possibly inflict Weak Grip. Creatures without weapons can't have Weak Grip.
Action 3: Flourish: Feint an attack to possibly throw your opponent Off Balance.

Name: Rapier +1
Description: Rapier +1 is an uncommon, lightly enchanted (+1) variant of the Rapiers family of weapons. It is a martial melee weapon wielded in one hand. As a finesse weapon, it can benefit from the wielder's Dexterity and not just their Strength.
Action 1: Piercing Strike: Stab an enemy and possibly inflict Gaping Wounds. Undead and Constructs can't suffer Gaping Wounds.
Action 2: Weakening Strike: Target an enemy's hands with a non-lethal attack and possibly inflict Weak Grip. Creatures without weapons can't have Weak Grip.
Action 3: Flourish: Feint an attack to possibly throw your opponent Off Balance.
Location: Has a chance to be sold by any trader using the magic melee table each time the player resets trader's inventories by long resting or levelling up.

Name: Rupturing Blade
Description: Rupturing Blade is an uncommon +1 Rapier that grants the Searing Blood weapon action that deals extra Fire damage on hit, but deals Slashing damage to the wielder. In addition, it also may cause Bleeding and Burning.
Action 1: Piercing Strike: Stab an enemy and possibly inflict Gaping Wounds. Undead and Constructs can't suffer Gaping Wounds.
Action 2: Weakening Strike: Target an enemy's hands with a non-lethal attack and possibly inflict Weak Grip. Creatures without weapons can't have Weak Grip.
Action 3: Flourish: Feint an attack to possibly throw your opponent Off Balance.
Special Action 1: Searing Blood: Cut into an enemy, dealing an extra proficiency bonusFire and 1d6Fire damage to them, while you yourself take 1d6Slashing damage. Additionally, the attack might cause the target to Bleed and Burn.
Location: This weapon can be bought from these traders: Brem in the Zhentarim Hideout after completing Find the Missing Shipment.

Name: Sanguine Blade
Description: Sanguine Blade is an uncommon Rapier that grants better Attack rolls, damage, and Spell Save DC for every foe slain (up to 3) and possibly inflicts Bleeding while the wielder is Hiding or Invisible.
Special Attribute 1: Scarlet Remittance: Gain a +1 bonus to Attack rolls, damage, and Spell Save DC for every foe you slay, up to a maximum of +3.
Special Attribute 2: Scarlet Regeneration: If you have a +3 bonus from Scarlet Remittance, consume it to recover 3d10hit points (Recharge: Long rest).
Action 1: Flourish: Feint an attack to possibly throw your opponent Off Balance.
Action 2: Piercing Strike: Stab an enemy and possibly inflict Gaping Wounds. Undead and Constructs can't suffer Gaping Wounds.
Action 3: Weakening Strike: Target an enemy's hands with a non-lethal attack and possibly inflict Weak Grip. Creatures without weapons can't have Weak Grip.

Name: Sword of Screams
Description: Sword of Screams is an uncommon Rapier that deals an additional 1d4 Psychic damage.
Action 1: Flourish: Feint an attack to possibly throw your opponent Off Balance.
Action 2: Piercing Strike: Stab an enemy and possibly inflict Gaping Wounds. Undead and Constructs can't suffer Gaping Wounds.
Action 3: Weakening Strike: Target an enemy's hands with a non-lethal attack and possibly inflict Weak Grip. Creatures without weapons can't have Weak Grip.
Location: Dropped by Nere in Grymforge.

Name: Adamantine Scimitar
Description: Adamantine Scimitar is a rare +1 Scimitar that automatically critical hits objects and ignores Resistance to Slashing damage.
Special Attribute 1: Diamondsbane: If an adamantine weapon hits an object, the hit is always critical.
Special Attribute 2: Lethal Weapon: This weapon ignores Resistance to Slashing damage.
Action 1: Flourish: Feint an attack to possibly throw your opponent Off Balance.
Action 2: Lacerate: Slash at your target's vital points to make it Bleed. Some Undead and Constructs can't suffer Bleeding.
Location: The Adamantine Scimitar can be forged in the Adamantine Forge with a Scimitar Mould and Mithral Ore.

Name: Belm
Description: Belm is a very rare +2 Scimitar that grants the Whirlwind Attack and Perfectly Balanced Strike weapon actions.
Action 1: Flourish: Feint an attack to possibly throw your opponent Off Balance.
Action 2: Lacerate: Slash at your target's vital points to make it Bleed. Some Undead and Constructs can't suffer Bleeding.
Special Action 1: Whirlwind Attack: Strike out at all nearby foes, making separate Attack rolls against each target.
Special Action 2: Perfectly Balanced Strike: Send Belm snaking out with an adder's speed, the very exemplar of swiftness embodied in steel.
Location: Found in an Opulent Chest X:-1572Y:976 in Jaheira's Basement under Elerrathin's Home in the Lower City. The chest is in a room behind a DC18 locked bookcase X:-1562Y:980.

Name: Justiciar's Scimitar
Description: Justiciar's Scimitar is a very rare Scimitar weapon that can blind an opponent if the wielder strikes with Advantage. It also grants the Shadowsoaked Blow weapon action.
Special Attribute 1: Shadow-Blinding: If you attack with Advantage, you have a chance to Blind your target.
Action 1: Weakening Strike: Target an enemy's hands with a non-lethal attack and possibly inflict Weak Grip. Creatures without weapons can't have Weak Grip.
Action 2: Flourish: Feint an attack to possibly throw your opponent Off Balance.
Special Action 1: Shadowsoaked Blow: Strike an enemy, adding your proficiency bonus to the damage. Moreover, if the attack hits, it deals an additional 1d6Psychic damage. This attack doesn't break concealment.
Location: Looted from Lyrthindor in the Gauntlet of Shar. Lyrthindor is involved in the quest Break Yurgir's Contract. He can be found at the foot of the large statue of Shar X:-713Y:-732, though you must first speak with and follow the rats to this location in order to find him.

Name: Goblin Scimitar
Description: Goblin Scimitar is a common variant of the Scimitars family of weapons. It is a martial melee weapon wielded in one hand. As a finesse weapon, it can benefit from the wielder's Dexterity and not just their Strength. It's a light weapon that anyone can dual-wield without special training.
Action 1: Lacerate: Slash at your target's vital points to make it Bleed. Some Undead and Constructs can't suffer Bleeding.
Action 2: Flourish: Feint an attack to possibly throw your opponent Off Balance.
Location: Looted from dead goblins and found in the Goblin Camp.

Name: Kurwin's Cauteriser
Description: Kurwin's Cauteriser is an uncommon +1 Scimitar that deals extra Fire damage on hit, and possibly Burns the target as well.
Special Attribute 1: Cauteriser: Deals an additional 1d4Fire. On a hit, the target starts Burning unless it succeeds a Constitution Saving throw.
Action 1: Flourish: Feint an attack to possibly throw your opponent Off Balance.
Action 2: Lacerate: Slash at your target's vital points to make it Bleed. Some Undead and Constructs can't suffer Bleeding.
Location: Looted from Bugthimble in Graveyard (Lower City) in Act III.

Name: Scimitar
Description: Scimitar is a mundane, nonmagical variant of the Scimitars family of weapons. It is a martial melee weapon wielded in one hand. As a finesse weapon, it can benefit from the wielder's Dexterity and not just their Strength. It's a light weapon that anyone can dual-wield without special training.
Action 1: Lacerate: Slash at your target's vital points to make it Bleed. Some Undead and Constructs can't suffer Bleeding.
Action 2: Flourish: Feint an attack to possibly throw your opponent Off Balance.

Name: Scimitar +1
Description: Scimitar +1 is an uncommon, lightly enchanted (+1) variant of the Scimitars family of weapons. It is a martial melee weapon wielded in one hand. As a finesse weapon, it can benefit from the wielder's Dexterity and not just their Strength. It's a light weapon that anyone can dual-wield without special training.
Action 1: Lacerate: Slash at your target's vital points to make it Bleed. Some Undead and Constructs can't suffer Bleeding.
Action 2: Flourish: Feint an attack to possibly throw your opponent Off Balance.
Location: Has a chance to be sold by any trader using the magic melee table each time the player resets trader's inventories by long resting or levelling up.

Name: Speedy Reply
Description: Speedy Reply is an uncommon Scimitar that grants the wielder 2 turns of Momentum whenever they hit an enemy.
Special Attribute 1: Nimble Attack: When the wielder hits an enemy with this weapon, they gain Momentum for 2 turns.
Action 1: Lacerate: Slash at your target's vital points to make it Bleed. Some Undead and Constructs can't suffer Bleeding.
Action 2: Flourish: Feint an attack to possibly throw your opponent Off Balance.
Location: Momentum Duration: 2 turns  Spurred on by a sense of urgency. Movement Speed increased by 1.5m / 5.0ft per remaining duration of this effect. Removed when Restrained, Incapacitated, Prone, or slowed down. Momentum has a maximum Duration: 5 turns.

Name: Sylvan Scimitar
Description: Sylvan Scimitar is an uncommon +1 Scimitar that allows its wielder to use their Spellcasting Ability modifier instead of their Dexterity modifier to determine their Attack Roll bonus.
Special Attribute 1: Melee Caster: Instead of its Dexterity Modifier, the affected entity add its Spellcasting Ability Modifier to Attack rolls.
Action 1: Lacerate: Slash at your target's vital points to make it Bleed. Some Undead and Constructs can't suffer Bleeding.
Action 2: Flourish: Feint an attack to possibly throw your opponent Off Balance.
Action 3: Cleave: Swing your weapon in a large arc to attack up to 3 enemies at once. They each take half the damage your weapon usually deals.
Location: This weapon is held by Jaheira. It can be obtained by killing and looting her, or recruiting her.

Name: Thorn Blade
Description: Thorn Blade is a rare, lightly enchanted (+1) Scimitar that deals 1d4Poison damage with melee weapons attacks while Concentrating and grants the ability to cast Ensnaring Strike (Melee).
Special Attribute 1: Poisonous Synergy: While concentrating, your melee weapon attacks deal an additional 1d4Poison.
Special Attribute 2: Ensnaring Strike (Melee): Cast as a level 1 spell (Recharge: Long rest).
Action 1: Flourish: Feint an attack to possibly throw your opponent Off Balance.
Action 2: Lacerate: Slash at your target's vital points to make it Bleed. Some Undead and Constructs can't suffer Bleeding.
Location: Bought from Dammon in Act 2 at the Last Light Inn.

Name: Blightbringer
Description: Blightbringer is a very rare +1 Shortbow that grants bonuses to attack and damage rolls against Gnomes and Dwarves, and Slows on a critical hit.
Special Attribute 1: Blightbringer: Attacking Gnomes or Dwarves with this weapon receives a 1d4 bonus to Attack and Damage rolls.
Special Attribute 2: Prey Decelerator: When this weapon lands a Critical Hit, it also Slows the target creature.
Action 1: Hamstring Shot: Shoot an enemy in the thigh and possibly reduce their Movement Speed by 50%.
Location: Act Three: Sold by Entharl Danthelon at Danthelon's Dancing Axe in Wyrm's Crossing.

Name: Bow of Awareness
Description: Bow of Awareness is an uncommon +1 Shortbow that boosts the wielder's Initiative.
Special Attribute 1: Seldom Caught Unawares: You gain a +1 bonus to Initiative rolls.
Action 1: Hamstring Shot: Shoot an enemy in the thigh and possibly reduce their Movement Speed by 50%.
Location: This weapon can be bought from these traders: Roah Moonglow in the Shattered Sanctum

Name: Bow of the Banshee
Description: Bow of the Banshee is a rare +1 shortbow that can Frighten targets on hit and grants bonuses to weapon damage and attack rolls against Frightened creatures.
Special Attribute 1: Blood-Curdling Emission: On a hit, possibly inflict Frightened. Gain a +1d4 bonus to attack and damage against Frightened creatures.
Action 1: Hamstring Shot: Shoot an enemy in the thigh and possibly reduce their Movement Speed by 50%.
Location: Looted from Corsair Greymon during the encounter that takes place after boarding the boat found in the Decrepit Village, Underdark. If he survives the journey, he will be selling this bow at his trading spot near Nere's cave-in, Grymforge X:-632Y:326.

Name: Darkfire Shortbow
Description: Darkfire Shortbow is a rare +2 Shortbow that grants Resistance to Fire and Cold and grants the ability to cast Haste.
Special Attribute 1: Resistance to Fire damage.
Special Attribute 2: Resistance to Cold damage.
Special Attribute 3: Haste: Cast as a level 3 spell (Recharge: Long rest).
Action 1: Hamstring Shot: Shoot an enemy in the thigh and possibly reduce their Movement Speed by 50%.
Location: Sold by Dammon at the Last Light Inn stables X:-35Y:169.

Name: Goblin Bow
Description: A Goblin Bow is the favored ranged weapon used and created by Goblins. Besides appearances, it functions exactly like a normal Shortbow.
Action 1: Hamstring Shot: Shoot an enemy in the thigh and possibly reduce their Movement Speed by 50%.
Location: Looted from dead goblins and found in the Goblin Camp.

Name: Hunting Shortbow
Description: Hunting Shortbow is an uncommon, +1 Shortbow that grants Advantage against Monstrosity type enemies and the ability to cast Hunter's Mark.
Special Attribute 1: Feller of Monsters: You have Advantage against Monstrosity type enemies.
Special Attribute 2: Hunter's Mark: Cast as a level 1 spell (Recharge: Long rest).
Action 1: Hamstring Shot: Shoot an enemy in the thigh and possibly reduce their Movement Speed by 50%.
Location: Purchased from Dammon in Druid Grove.

Name: Least Expected
Description: Least Expected is a rare +2 Shortbow that increases Attack Rolls while obscured in shadow and also grants the Blinding Shot weapon action.
Special Attribute 1: Darkveil Precision: While obscured in shadow, the wielder has a +1d4 bonus to their ranged weapon attacks.
Action 1: Hamstring Shot: Shoot an enemy in the thigh and possibly reduce their Movement Speed by 50%.
Special Action 1: Blinding Shot: Weave the lost magic of the children of Deep Duerra into your shot and possibly Blind your target.
Location: Looted from a Gilded Chest in the Gauntlet of Shar X:-730Y:-800.

Name: Makeshift Bow
Description: Makeshift Bow is a common variant of the Shortbows family of weapons. It is a martial ranged weapon that's wielded with both hands. It's a light weapon that anyone can dual-wield without special training.
Action 1: Hamstring Shot: Shoot an enemy in the thigh and possibly reduce their Movement Speed by 50%.
Location: Can be looted from skeleton archer raised by the player. [Needs Verification]

Name: Shortbow
Description: Shortbow is a mundane, nonmagical variant of the Shortbows family of weapons. It is a simple ranged weapon that's wielded with both hands.
Action 1: Hamstring Shot: Shoot an enemy in the thigh and possibly reduce their Movement Speed by 50%.
Location: Starting equipment for ranger.

Name: Shortbow +1
Description: Shortbow +1 is an uncommon, lightly enchanted (+1) variant of the Shortbows family of weapons. It is a simple ranged weapon that's wielded with both hands.
Action 1: Hamstring Shot: Shoot an enemy in the thigh and possibly reduce their Movement Speed by 50%.
Location: This weapon can be bought from these traders: Dammon in the Druid Grove Derryth Bonecloak in the Myconid Colony

Name: Vicious Shortbow
Description: Vicious Shortbow is a rare Shortbow that deals 7 additional damage on a Critical Hit.
Special Attribute 1: Dolor Amarus: When you land a Critical Hit with any weapon attack, it deals an additional 7 damage.
Action 1: Hamstring Shot: Shoot an enemy in the thigh and possibly reduce their Movement Speed by 50%.
Location: Sold by Echo of Abazigal in the Murder Tribunal after the player character accepts Bhaal and becomes an Unholy Assassin.

Name: Ambusher
Description: Ambusher is a rare +1 Shortsword that grants the wielder bonuses to Initiative and Advantage on Perception checks and deals extra Necrotic damage on creatures that haven't taken a turn yet.
Special Attribute 1: Sentinel Weapon: Gain a +1 bonus to Initiative rolls and Advantage on Perception Ability Checks.
Special Attribute 2: Ambusher's Streak: In combat, you deal an additional 1d6Necrotic damage against creatures that haven't taken a turn yet.
Action 1: Flourish: Feint an attack to possibly throw your opponent Off Balance.
Action 2: Piercing Strike: Stab an enemy and possibly inflict Gaping Wounds. Undead and Constructs can't suffer Gaping Wounds.
Location: Sold by Exxvikyap in Rivington General in Rivington.

Name: Crimson Mischief
Description: Crimson Mischief is a legendary Shortsword that, when wielded in the main hand, grants additional damage when attacking with Advantage and against targets with 50% or less of their hit points. When wielded in the off-hand, it instead allows the wielder to add their Ability Modifier to their damage.
Special Attribute 1: Prey Upon the Weak: This weapon deals an additional 1d4Piercing damage against targets with 50% of their hit points or fewer.
Action 1: Flourish: Feint an attack to possibly throw your opponent Off Balance.
Action 2: Piercing Strike: Stab an enemy and possibly inflict Gaping Wounds. Undead and Constructs can't suffer Gaping Wounds.
Location: Dropped by Orin during Get Orin's Netherstone in Act Three.

Name: Fleshrender
Description: Fleshrender is a rare Shortsword that allows the wielder to make a diabolical strike, possibly stymying their target's ability to heal.
Action 1: Flourish: Feint an attack to possibly throw your opponent Off Balance.
Action 2: Piercing Strike: Stab an enemy and possibly inflict Gaping Wounds. Undead and Constructs can't suffer Gaping Wounds.
Special Action 1: Part the Flesh: Thrust forward with diabolical precision, possibly stymying your target's ability to heal.
Location: Sold by Echo of Abazigal in the Murder Tribunal after the player character accepts Bhaal and becomes an Unholy Assassin.

Name: Githyanki Shortsword
Description: Githyanki Shortsword is a common variant of the Shortswords family of weapons. It is a martial melee weapon wielded in one hand. As a finesse weapon, it can benefit from the wielder's Dexterity and not just their Strength. It's a light weapon that anyone can dual-wield without special training.
Action 1: Flourish: Feint an attack to possibly throw your opponent Off Balance.
Action 2: Piercing Strike: Stab an enemy and possibly inflict Gaping Wounds. Undead and Constructs can't suffer Gaping Wounds.
Location: Found on weapon racks and equipped by numerous Githyanki in Crèche Y'llek.

Name: Knife of the Undermountain King
Description: The Knife of the Undermountain King is a very rare +2 shortsword that increases the frequency of scoring Critical Hits and grants Advantage against enemies in the shadows.
Special Attribute 1: Organ Rearranger: Reduce the number you need to roll a Critical Hit while attacking by 1. When they roll 2 damage or less, reroll the dice, taking the highest result.
Special Attribute 2: Shadow Blade: You have Advantage on Attack rolls against Lightly or Heavily Obscured targets when using this blade.
Action 1: Flourish: Feint an attack to possibly throw your opponent Off Balance.
Action 2: Piercing Strike: Stab an enemy and possibly inflict Gaping Wounds. Undead and Constructs can't suffer Gaping Wounds.
Location: Can be bought or looted from A'jak'nir Jeera in Crèche Y'llek.

Name: Practice Sword
Description: The Practice Sword is a common Shortsword. It lacks the weapon actions of other shortswords, but is also the only shortsword that deals Bludgeoning damage.
Location: Four of these can be found in the Emerald Grove in The Hollow where Wyll is helping train the tiefling children. One can be found in Crèche Y'llek in the infirmary in training area. Two can also be found in the House of Healing in Act Two.

Name: Render of Mind and Body
Description: Render of Mind and Body is an uncommon +1 Shortsword that deals additional Psychic damage whenever the attack is made at Advantage.
Special Attribute 1: Psychic Steel Virtuoso: When the wielder attacks with Advantage, they deal an additional 1d8Psychic.
Action 1: Flourish: Feint an attack to possibly throw your opponent Off Balance.
Action 2: Piercing Strike: Stab an enemy and possibly inflict Gaping Wounds. Undead and Constructs can't suffer Gaping Wounds.
Location: Sold by Lann Tarv in the main floor of Moonrise Towers, if you convince Disciple Z'rell to give you additional aid in finding Ketheric's relic.

Name: Shortsword
Description: Shortsword is a mundane, nonmagical variant of the Shortswords family of weapons. It is a martial melee weapon wielded in one hand. As a finesse weapon, it can benefit from the wielder's Dexterity and not just their Strength. It's a light weapon that anyone can dual-wield without special training.
Action 1: Piercing Strike: Stab an enemy and possibly inflict Gaping Wounds. Undead and Constructs can't suffer Gaping Wounds.
Action 2: Flourish: Feint an attack to possibly throw your opponent Off Balance.
Location: Starting equipment for rogue. Common loot throughout the game.

Name: Shortsword +1
Description: Shortsword +1 is an uncommon, lightly enchanted (+1) variant of the Shortswords family of weapons. It is a martial melee weapon wielded in one hand. As a finesse weapon, it can benefit from the wielder's Dexterity and not just their Strength. It's a light weapon that anyone can dual-wield without special training.
Action 1: Piercing Strike: Stab an enemy and possibly inflict Gaping Wounds. Undead and Constructs can't suffer Gaping Wounds.
Action 2: Flourish: Feint an attack to possibly throw your opponent Off Balance.
Location: Has a chance to be sold by any trader using the magic melee table each time the player resets trader's inventories by long resting or levelling up.

Name: Shortsword of First Blood
Description: The Shortsword of First Blood is an uncommon shortsword that deals more damage to enemies who haven't been injured yet.
Special Attribute 1: Break the Unbroken: Deals an additional 1d8Piercing to targets that still have all their hit points.
Action 1: Flourish: Feint an attack to possibly throw your opponent Off Balance.
Action 2: Piercing Strike: Stab an enemy and possibly inflict Gaping Wounds. Undead and Constructs can't suffer Gaping Wounds.
Location: Found on the corpse of an executed Deep Gnome in the Underdark at (X:73, Y:-187), at the entrance of the Decrepit Village (if approaching from the Myconid Colony).

Name: Slicing Shortsword
Description: The Slicing Shortsword is a rare +1 shortsword that inflicts Bleeding when the wielder attacks with advantage.
Special Attribute 1: Deepflesh Slice: When the wielder attacks with Advantage, the attack inflicts Bleeding.
Action 1: Flourish: Feint an attack to possibly throw your opponent Off Balance.
Action 2: Piercing Strike: Stab an enemy and possibly inflict Gaping Wounds. Undead and Constructs can't suffer Gaping Wounds.
Location: Sold by Lann Tarv in the main floor of Moonrise Towers.

Name: Steelforged Sword
Description: Steelforged Sword is an uncommon, lightly enchanted (+1) variant of the Shortswords family of weapons. It is a martial melee weapon wielded in one hand. As a finesse weapon, it can benefit from the wielder's Dexterity and not just their Strength. It's a light weapon that anyone can dual-wield without special training.
Action 1: Piercing Strike: Stab an enemy and possibly inflict Gaping Wounds. Undead and Constructs can't suffer Gaping Wounds.
Action 2: Flourish: Feint an attack to possibly throw your opponent Off Balance.
Location: This weapon can be found in a locked chest in the abandoned workshop in the Blighted Village, across from the Ancient Rune Circle (X:45, Y:408). A second can be found in the Watch Citadel in The High Hall, on a table of goods owned by Koll.

Name: Sword of Clutching Umbra
Description: Sword of Clutching Umbra is a rare, lightly enchanted (+1) Shortsword that grants the wielder a unique weapon action, Shadowsoaked Blow.
Action 1: Flourish: Feint an attack to possibly throw your opponent Off Balance.
Action 2: Piercing Strike: Stab an enemy and possibly inflict Gaping Wounds. Undead and Constructs can't suffer Gaping Wounds.
Special Action 1: Shadowsoaked Blow: Strike an enemy, adding your proficiency bonus to the damage. Moreover, if the attack hits, it deals an additional 1d6Psychic damage. This attack doesn't break concealment.
Location: Bought from Dammon in Act 2 at the Last Light Inn.

Name: Sword of Life Stealing
Description: The Sword of Life Stealing is a very rare +2 Shortsword that deals an extra 10 Necrotic damage on a critical hit, and heals the wielder for the same amount.
Special Attribute 1: Life Stealing Critical: On a Critical Hit, the target takes an extra 10NecroticDRS damage as long as it isn't a construct or an undead. You also gain 10 temporary hit points.
Action 1: Piercing Strike: Stab an enemy and possibly inflict Gaping Wounds. Undead and Constructs can't suffer Gaping Wounds.
Action 2: Flourish: Feint an attack to possibly throw your opponent Off Balance.
Location: Sold by Dammon at the Last Light Inn in Chapter Two.

Name: The Clover
Description: The Clover is a legendary, moderately enchanted (+2) special variant of the Scimitars family of weapons. It is a martial melee weapon wielded in one hand. As a finesse weapon, it can benefit from the wielder's Dexterity and not just their Strength. It's a light weapon that anyone can dual-wield without special training.
Special Attribute 1: Organ Rearranger: Reduce the number you need to roll a Critical Hit while attacking by 1. When they roll 2 damage or less, reroll the dice, taking the highest result.
Special Attribute 2: True Strike: Cast as a cantrip (Recharge: Short rest).
Action 1: Flourish: Feint an attack to possibly throw your opponent Off Balance.
Action 2: Lacerate: Slash at your target's vital points to make it Bleed. Some Undead and Constructs can't suffer Bleeding.

Name: The Baneful
Description: The The Baneful is a rare +1 shortsword that only functions if it's Bound to an Eldritch Knight or is a Warlock's Pact weapon. It also applies the Bane condition on hit.
Special Attribute 1: Favoured Weapon: This weapon has a +1 bonus to damage and Attack rolls.
Special Attribute 2: Baneful Bond: On a hit, possibly Bane your target.
Action 1: Flourish: Feint an attack to possibly throw your opponent Off Balance.
Action 2: Piercing Strike: Stab an enemy and possibly inflict Gaping Wounds. Undead and Constructs can't suffer Gaping Wounds.
Location: Sold by Blurg in the Myconid Colony.

Name: Assassin's Shortsword
Description: Assassin's Shortsword is an uncommon Shortsword that grants the wielder Advantage on Stealth checks.
Special Attribute 1: Advantage on Stealth Checks.
Action 1: Flourish: Feint an attack to possibly throw your opponent Off Balance.
Action 2: Piercing Strike: Stab an enemy and possibly inflict Gaping Wounds. Undead and Constructs can't suffer Gaping Wounds.
Location: Found on one of a pair of skeletons along the cliffs west of the House of Healing (X:-252, Y:36). The other skeleton has the Watcher's Shield.

Name: Sickle
Description: Sickle is a mundane, nonmagical variant of the Sickles family of weapons. It is a simple melee weapon wielded in one hand. It's a light weapon that anyone can dual-wield without special training.
Action 1: Lacerate: Slash at your target's vital points to make it Bleed. Some Undead and Constructs can't suffer Bleeding.

Name: Sickle of BOOOAL
Description: Sickle of BOOOAL is a rare variant of the Sickles family of weapons. It is a Simple melee weapon wielded in one hand. It's a light weapon that anyone can dual-wield without special training.
Action 1: Lacerate: Slash at your target's vital points to make it Bleed. Some Undead and Constructs can't suffer Bleeding.
Location: BOOOAL's Blessing   Advantage on Attack rolls against Bleeding creatures, as long as there are Kuo-toa to worship BOOOAL.

Name: Sussur Sickle
Description: The Sussur Sickle is a Rare +1 Sickle that silences the targets it strikes, making it very effective against spellcasters.
Special Attribute 1: Silences targets on hit.
Action 1: Lacerate: Slash at your target's vital points to make it Bleed. Some Undead and Constructs can't suffer Bleeding.
Location: Silenced Duration: 2 turns DC 12 Constitution saving throw  Creature can't speak or cast spells with a verbal component, and is immune to Thunder damage.

Name: Wavemother's Sickle
Description: Wavemother's Sickle is a rare, +2 Sickle that grants the wielder Advantage against targets with the Wet condition.
Special Attribute 1: Watery Guidance: This weapon has Advantage against Wet creatures.
Action 1: Lacerate: Slash at your target's vital points to make it Bleed. Some Undead and Constructs can't suffer Bleeding.
Location: Looted from Allandra Grey

Name: Jagged Spear
Description: Jagged Spear is an uncommon Spear that allows the wielder to possibly give their targets Disadvantage on Constitution Saving Throws.
Special Attribute 1: Torturous Edges: Tortured creatures may receive Disadvantage on Constitution Saving throws.
Action 1: Rush Attack: Charge forward and attack the first enemy in your way, possibly pushing them Off Balance.
Location: On the ground near Torturer Spike in the Shattered Sanctum X:334Y:-37.

Name: Lightning Jabber
Description: Lightning Jabber is an uncommon +1 Spear that deals extra Lightning damage when thrown, and also has a chance to Shock a target on hit.
Special Attribute 1: Shocking Sting: On a hit, possibly Shock your target.
Special Attribute 2: Throwing: Lightning Damage: When launched at a target, deal an additional 1d4Lightning damage.
Action 1: Rush Attack: Charge forward and attack the first enemy in your way, possibly pushing them Off Balance.
Location: Shocked  Cannot take reactions and has Disadvantage on Ability Checks and Saving Throws using Dexterity.

Name: Pitchfork
Description: Pitchfork is a mundane, nonmagical variant of the Spears family of weapons. It is a simple melee weapon that must be wielded in both hands as it lacks the Versatile quality. It also cannot be used as a proper Thrown weapon as it also lacks that trait.
Action 1: Rush Attack: Charge forward and attack the first enemy in your way, possibly pushing them Off Balance.
Location: Throughout the world, most often in settlements.

Name: Selune's Spear of Night
Description: Selûne's Spear of Night is a legendary Spear that allows the wielder to cast Moonbeam and grants Darkvision as well as Advantage on Wisdom Saving Throws and Perception Checks.
Special Attribute 1: Selûne's Blessing: You gain Advantage on Wisdom Saving throws and Perception Checks.
Special Attribute 2: Darkvision: Can see in the dark up to 12 m / 40 ft.
Special Attribute 3: Moonbeam: Cast as a level 3 spell (Recharge: Long rest).
Special Attribute 4: Moonmote: Cast as a cantrip (Recharge: Long rest).
Action 1: Rush Attack: Charge forward and attack the first enemy in your way, possibly pushing them Off Balance.
Action 2: Maiming Strike: Possibly Maims your target. They can't move. Flying creatures can't be Maimed.
Location: Spoiler warning! This section reveals details about the story of Baldur's Gate 3.   Reward for sparing the Nightsong during Shadowheart's personal quest, The Chosen of Shar. This spear is granted after completing Infiltrate Moonrise Towers, upon speaking to Dame Aylin in camp for the first time. WARNING: there is a bug that can prevent you from obtaining the weapon - use your main character to speak to Aylin in camp for the first time, speaking with Shadowheart seems to show the animation, but the item is not granted.

Name: Shar's Spear of Evening
Description: Shar's Spear of Evening is a legendary Spear that allows the wielder to gain Shar's Blessing and immunity to blindness.
Special Attribute 1: Shar's Blessing: You gain Advantage on Saving throws while Lightly or Heavily Obscured. This weapon deals an additional 1d6 damage to creatures that are Lightly or Heavily Obscured.
Special Attribute 2: Blind Immunity: The wearer cannot be Blinded.
Special Attribute 3: Shar's Darkness: Cast as a level 2 spell (Recharge: Per turn).
Action 1: Rush Attack: Charge forward and attack the first enemy in your way, possibly pushing them Off Balance.
Action 2: Maiming Strike: Possibly Maims your target. They can't move. Flying creatures can't be Maimed.
Special Action 1: Edge of Darkness: Create a cloud of Darkness while you attack. [See Notes]
Location: Spoiler warning: The following content contains unhidden spoilers. Read at your own risk. Reward for the quest The Chosen of Shar, for convincing Shadowheart to kill the Nightsong in the Shadowfell.

Name: Spear
Description: Spear is a mundane, nonmagical variant of the Spears family of weapons. It is a simple melee weapon that can be wielded in one hand, or with both hands for extra damage.  Its design lends itself well to be thrown at enemies as a projectile. Its design doesn't lend itself to be dual-wielded, even by those with special training in dual-wielding.
Action 1: Rush Attack: Charge forward and attack the first enemy in your way, possibly pushing them Off Balance.

Name: Spear +1
Description: Spear +1 is an uncommon, lightly enchanted (+1) variant of the Spears family of weapons. It is a simple melee weapon that can be wielded in one hand, or with both hands for extra damage.  Its design lends itself well to be thrown at enemies as a projectile.
Action 1: Rush Attack: Charge forward and attack the first enemy in your way, possibly pushing them Off Balance.
Location: Has a chance to be sold by any trader using the magic melee table each time the player resets trader's inventories by long resting or levelling up.

Name: Spear of Night
Description: Spear of Night is a rare, lightly enchanted (+1) variant of the Spears family of weapons. It is a simple melee weapon that can be wielded in one hand, or with both hands for extra damage.  Its design lends itself well to be thrown at enemies as a projectile.
Special Attribute 1: Shar's Blessing: If Shar allows it, use this spear to kill Nightsong.
Action 1: Rush Attack: Charge forward and attack the first enemy in your way, possibly pushing them Off Balance.
Location: Found resting on a shine in the Silent Library, inside the Gauntlet of Shar X:-820Y:-756.

Name: The Watcher's Guide
Description: The Watcher's Guide is an uncommon Spear that increases the chance to hit a target after the wielder misses it.
Special Attribute 1: Death's Promise: When the spear misses its target, the wielder's next Attack roll against that target gains True Strike.
Action 1: Rush Attack: Charge forward and attack the first enemy in your way, possibly pushing them Off Balance.
Location: True Strike Duration: 2 turns  The spellcaster has Advantage on Attack rolls against this creature.

Name: Vision of the Absolute
Description: Vision of the Absolute is an uncommon Spear that possibly blinds targets and deals additional Piercing damage against targets with multiple eyes.
Special Attribute 1: Absolute Night: Blind targets that fail a Dexterity saving throw. Deals an additional 2d6Piercing to certain creatures that sport multiple sets of eyes.
Action 1: Rush Attack: Charge forward and attack the first enemy in your way, possibly pushing them Off Balance.
Location: Repaired by finding and combining the Shaft of a Broken Spear and the Head of a Broken Spear (by right-clicking on one of the items in your inventory and pressing 'combine', then dragging the other item into the open slot.) Shaft of a Broken Spear: Found on the body of Edowin in the Forest west of the Druid Grove X:136Y:446. Head of a Broken Spear: Looted from the Owlbear in the Owlbear Nest.

Name: Allandra's Whelm
Description: Allandra's Whelm is a rare, moderately enchanted (+2) variant of the Tridents family of weapons. It is a martial melee weapon that can be wielded in one hand, or with both hands for extra damage.  Its design lends itself well to be thrown at enemies as a projectile.
Action 1: Rush Attack: Charge forward and attack the first enemy in your way, possibly pushing them Off Balance.
Action 2: Piercing Strike: Stab an enemy and possibly inflict Gaping Wounds. Undead and Constructs can't suffer Gaping Wounds.
Action 3: Maiming Strike: Possibly Maims your target. They can't move. Flying creatures can't be Maimed.
Special Action 1: Frigid Blade: You add your Proficiency Bonus as Cold Damage.
Location: Not accessible through normal gameplay, but can still be accessed via third party tools.

Name: Nyrulna
Description: Nyrulna is a legendary, +3 trident that can be thrown to create an explosion that deals Thunder damage in an area. It grants additional movement speed and jump distance and will return to the wielder after being thrown.
Special Attribute 1: Zephyr Connection: This weapon will return to your hand when thrown. You cannot be forced to drop the trident. When thrown, the weapon creates an explosion that deals 3d4Thunder damage in a 6m / 20ft blast centered on the target.
Special Attribute 2: Veil of the Wind: You gain a + 3m / 10ft bonus to movement speed and jump distance. Equipping this weapon gives you Immunity to falling damage.
Special Attribute 3: Nyrulna: Glowing: This object shines with a glowing Light in a radius of 6m / 20ft.
Action 1: Piercing Strike: Stab an enemy and possibly inflict Gaping Wounds. Undead and Constructs can't suffer Gaping Wounds.
Action 2: Maiming Strike: Possibly Maims your target. They can't move. Flying creatures can't be Maimed.
Special Action 1: Zephyr Flash: Rush forward, creating an air vortex that blasts foes and possibly inflicts Bleeding.
Special Action 2: Zephyr Break: Zephyr Break imitates the effects of the spell Gust of Wind while dealing thunder damage.
Location: Win the jackpot from Akabi, found in the Circus of the Last Days in Rivington, by first pickpocketing his Djinni Ring. Nyrulna is found in a DC 20 locked Painted Chest in the JungleX:-1511Y:-1522 he teleports you to, right next to the exit portal. If the character is a Bard, it is also possible to win the jackpot by passing a DC15 Performance check after noticing that Akabi is cheating.

Name: The Sparky Points
Description: The Sparky Points is a rare Trident that allows the wielder to generate Lightning Charges upon dealing damage with this weapon.
Special Attribute 1: Electric Blood: When the wielder deals damage using this weapon, they gain 2 Lightning Charges.
Action 1: Rush Attack: Charge forward and attack the first enemy in your way, possibly pushing them Off Balance.
Action 2: Piercing Strike: Stab an enemy and possibly inflict Gaping Wounds. Undead and Constructs can't suffer Gaping Wounds.
Action 3: Disarming Strike: Focus your attack on your foe's hands and possibly force them to drop the weapons they are holding.
Location: Reward for rescuing Counsellor Florrick from the burning inn of Waukeen's Rest during the quest Rescue the Grand Duke. One of three possible rewards for this quest, the other two being The Joltshooter and The Spellsparkler.

Description: Hoppy is an uncommon War Pick that allows the wielder to use Revitalising Strike.
Action 1: Maiming Strike: Possibly Maims your target. They can't move. Flying creatures can't be Maimed.
Action 2: Piercing Strike: Stab an enemy and possibly inflict Gaping Wounds. Undead and Constructs can't suffer Gaping Wounds.

Location: Sold by Lady Esther in the Rosymorn Monastery Trail area of Act One.

Name: Charge-Bound Warhammer
Description: Charge-Bound Warhammer is a rare, +1 Warhammer with +1 bonus to damage and Attack Rolls, and deals additional 1d6Lightning damage as long as it is bound to an Eldritch Knight or Warlock Pact Weapon.
Special Attribute 1: Favoured Weapon: This weapon has a +1 bonus to damage and Attack rolls.
Special Attribute 2: Shocking Bound: This weapon deals an additional 1d6Lightning damage.
Special Attribute 3: This hammer's magical powers only function if it's Bound to an Eldritch Knight or is a Warlock's Pact Weapon. These effects are in addition to the weapon's +1 enchantment.
Action 1: Backbreaker: Put extra force behind your strike to possibly knock your enemy Prone.
Action 2: Concussive Smash: Hit an enemy with all your might to deal damage and possibly Daze them.
Action 3: Weakening Strike: Target an enemy's hands with a non-lethal attack and possibly inflict Weak Grip. Creatures without weapons can't have Weak Grip.
Location: Can be purchased from Dammon in Last Light Inn

Name: Clown Hammer
Description: Clown Hammer is a rare +2 Warhammer that forces both the wielder and the target to make a Wisdom Saving Throw on a critical hit, or else fall down laughing.
Special Attribute 1: Grim Irony: Whenever this weapon lands a critical hit, both target and attacker have to succeed a Wisdom Saving Throw, or be affected by fits of laughter.

Name: Dwarven Thrower
Description: Dwarven Thrower is a very rare +2 Warhammer that returns to the wielder when thrown, and deals extra damage if the wielder is a Dwarf or the target is Large or greater.
Special Attribute 1: Homing Weapon: This weapon will return to its owner when thrown.
Special Attribute 2: Dwarven Thrower: A Dwarf throwing this warhammer deals an extra 1d8Bludgeoning damage. If the target is Large, Huge or Gargantuan creature, the strike deals an additional 2d8Bludgeoning damage.

Location: Dropped by Dror Ragzlin in the Shattered Sanctum X:297Y:40.

Name: Hammer of the Just
Description: Hammer of the Just is a rare +2 Warhammer that deals additional Radiant damage, additional Bludgeoning damage to Fiends and Undead, and allows the wielder to cast Detect Thoughts.
Special Attribute 1: Slay the Wicked: This weapon deals an additional 1d6Slashing damage against Fiends and Undead.
Special Attribute 2: Detect Thoughts: Cast as a level 1 spell (Recharge: Long rest).

Location: Looted from the Offerings to Tyr Chest in the basement of Stormshore Tabernacle in Lower City. The basement can be reached by entering the secret hatch in the corner of the tabernacle.

Name: Intransigent Warhammer
Description: Intransigent Warhammer is an uncommon Warhammer that knock nearby foes Prone after killing a hostile target or landing a Critical Hit.
Special Attribute 1: Impulse Blast: Knocks nearby creatures Prone after killing a target or landing a Critical Hit.
Action 1: Backbreaker: Put extra force behind your strike to possibly knock your enemy Prone.
